newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices show mixed results.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices show mixed results.

text.p: Indian Punjab cotton varieties on Tuesday lost recent gains while Gujarat cotton bounced back on the local cotton market, dealers said.
"Fresh arrivals in the Punjab region however remained low but a recent upsurge in the prices prompted demand resistance from the millers which dragged prices lower today," one dealer said.

In spot deals Punjab saw-ginned fell to 1,580/1,690 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) from 1,625/1,700 rupees while F-414 eased by 15/50 rupees at 1,910/1,925 rupees per maund. Bengal-deshi slid by 10 rupees at 900/925 rupees per maund.
"Gujarat varieties bounced back on fresh mill buying as millers switched their attention from Punjab cotton to Gujarat," one broker said.
In spot deals Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) climbed up to 13,600/14,200 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) from 13,500/13,700 rupees. -Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
